name: Mp Nair

portrait.alt: Curator Mp Nair standing in a dimly lit gallery, surrounded by paintings and soft reflections.

bioLead: Mp Nair curates exhibitions as if arranging dusk: carefully, patiently, with an ear tuned to the smallest tremor of light on a surface.
bioPoetic: Born between cities and coastlines, Nair learned to read museums the way others read weather—by the temperature of silence in a room.
She believes a gallery is not a corridor of masterpieces, but a temporary country where every work negotiates its own horizon.
Wall texts are written like letters, not labels; each exhibition is paced like a piece of chamber music: a prelude, a hush, a long sustaining note.
Her practice is devoted to hospitality of the eye—giving visitors just enough distance to feel unhurried, and just enough guidance to feel held.
statement: I do not arrange artworks; I arrange conditions for looking. A good exhibition does not shout its thesis. It stands very still and lets the works speak to one another until the visitor overhears a conversation they did not know they needed.
